indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
Número de productos financieros estructurados identificados. Número de programa de uniones de crédito y ahorro (UNICA). Número de familias atendidas con el programa UNICA.
Indicadores para 2013: 120 UNICAS conformadas y en funcionamiento en Lambayeque, Ayacucho e Ica.

baseline.comment: Identificación de la zona piloto conformada por los distritos de Zaña, Cayaltí y Nueva Arica para implementar el Programa - PRIDER. Linea de base para 2013: Lambayeque: Al cierre del año 2012, se han constituido 51 Uniones de Crédito y Ahorro – UNICAs. Ica y Ayacucho: No hay UNICAS.

target.comment: Producto 1. Actividad 1.1: 97 UNICAS en un proceso de seguimiento y monitoreo en Lambayeque (Distrito de Incahuasi, Provincia de Ferreñafe) Actividad 1.2: 40 nuevas UNICAS constituidas y en funcionamiento en Ica. Actividad 1.3: 40 nuevas UNICAS constituidas y en funcionamiento en Ayacucho. Para las actividades 1.2 y 1.3 del Producto 1: Al menos 50% de mujeres como miembros de UNICAS Al menos 45% de mujeres en cargos directivos de UNICAS Producto 2: Actividad 2.1: 7,500 personas capacitadas en la Tabla de Negocios. Actividad 2.1: Al menos 40% de mujeres capacitadas en tablas de negocios Actividad 2.2: 14,000 asistentes a la Feria del Emprendedor Actividad 2.4: 60 escuelas participan en el programa de Escuelas Emprendedoras y lo finalizan. Actividad 2.4: 20,000 estudiantes participan en el programa de Escuelas Emprendedoras. Actividad 2.4: Al menos 50% de niñas como participantes en programa de escuelas emprendedoras Actividad 2.5: 200 de emprendedores rurales capacitados y certificados (sectores a los que pertenecen). Actividad 2.5. 40 % de mujeres entre emprendedores rurales capacitados y certificados. Producto 3: Actividad 3.1: Al menos 7% de nuevos usuarios (2014) establecen contacto comercial con Ecuador Actividad 3.2: Versión 3.0 del Portal web en funcionamiento

actual.comment: Producto 1. Actividad 1.1: 97 UNICAS en un proceso de seguimiento y monitoreo en Lambayeque (Distrito de Incahuasi, Provincia de Ferreñafe) Actividad 1.2: 43 nuevas UNICAS constituidas y en funcionamiento en Ica, con 65% participación mujeres y 67% cargos directivos ocupados por mujeres. Actividad 1.3: 57 nuevas UNICAS constituidas y en funcionamiento en Ayacucho, con 68% participación mujeres y 54% cargos directivos ocupados por mujeres. Para las actividades 1.2 y 1.3 del Producto 1: Producto 2: Actividad 2.1: 6,733 personas capacitadas en la Tabla de Negocios. Actividad 2.2: 10,600 asistentes a la Feria del Emprendedor Actividad 2.4: 60 escuelas participan en el programa de Escuelas Emprendedoras y lo finalizan. Actividad 2.4: 32,082 estudiantes participan en el programa de Escuelas Emprendedoras. Actividad 2.5: 513 de emprendedores rurales capacitados y certificados (sectores a los que pertenecen). Actividad 2.5. 46 % de mujeres entre emprendedores rurales capacitados y certificados. Producto 3: Actividad 3.1 y 3.2: Retrasos en implementación - no se cumplen metas.

target.comment: Producto 1. 1. 50% de UNICAS en funcionamiento en Lambayeque e Ica en 2013 se gradúan 2. 95% de UNICAS creadas en Ayacucho en 2014 están operativas y se crea 80 UNICAS nuevas. 3. Al menos 70% de mujeres como miembros de UNICAS; al menos 55% cargos directivos ocupados por mujeres; al menos 40% de préstamos otorgados a mujeres. Producto 2: Actividad 2.1: 7,500 personas capacitadas en la Tabla de Negocios. Actividad 2.1: Al menos 40% de mujeres capacitadas en tablas de negocios Actividad 2.2: 14,000 asistentes a la Feria del Emprendedor Actividad 2.4: 60 escuelas participan en el programa de Escuelas Emprendedoras y lo finalizan. Actividad 2.4: 20,000 estudiantes participan en el programa de Escuelas Emprendedoras. Actividad 2.4: Al menos 50% de niñas como participantes en programa de escuelas emprendedoras Actividad 2.5: 200 de emprendedores rurales capacitados y certificados (sectores a los que pertenecen). Actividad 2.5. 40 % de mujeres entre emprendedores rurales capacitados y certificados. Producto 3: Actividad 3.1: Al menos 7% de nuevos usuarios (2014) establecen contacto comercial con Ecuador Actividad 3.2: Versión 3.0 del Portal web en funcionamiento

actual.comment:
2015 (anual): Producto 1. 1. 44% de UNICAS de Lambayeque y 89% de Ica se gradúan. 2. 20 nuevas UNICAS en Ayacucho, con participación de 252 personas. No hay información sobre operatividad de UNICAS creadas en 2014. 3. Participación de la mujer en Ayacucho: 67% membresía de UNICAS; 54% en cargos directivos; por confirmar participación en préstamos.
Producto 2: Actividad 2.1: Capacitaciones llevadas a cabo en enero y junio: 2,800 personas inscritas. Actividad 2.1: COFIDE prove información incompleta; por determinar. Actividad 2.2: Feria se realizará en noviembre Actividad 2.4: N/A. Actividad 2.4: N/A. Actividad 2.4: N/A Actividad 2.5: N/A Actividad 2.5. N/A. Producto 3: Actividad 3.1: N/A Actividad 3.2: N/A

baseline.comment: La Unidad del Informe sobre Desarrollo Humano cuenta con el IDH Perú 2009 concluído

target.comment: 1. INDH difundido en por lo menos 1 región de área amazónica, 1 región altoandina y 1 costera adicionales; en ministerios y entidades públicas pertinentes; en MCLCP, ANC y en gremios del sector privado. 2. Red de DH establecida y operativa.

actual.comment: 1. Presentación de INDH en Piura, La Libertad, Arequipa, Cusco, Cajamarca, Pasco y San Martín. Presentacion en MLCP, ANGR, Universidades, instituciones gremiales. 2. 4 talleres piloto para establecimiento de la Red a nivel regional. 3. Versión amigable del INDH difundida. 4. Borrador de cuaderno de desarrollo humano sobre seguridad alimentaria finalizado.

target.comment: 1. Tema INDH 2016 seleccionado

actual.comment:
1. El tema del INDH seleccionado es la seguridad ciudadana.
Se prepara nota conceptual para INDH en seguridad ciudadana en el primer semestre de 2015. Se decide poner el proceso de formulación on hold y retomar en 2016.

location.name: Cusco
location.description: seat of a first-order administrative division

result.title: Objective
result.description: Validate and promote a model of natural resources management compatible with productive uses and in association with government, communities, private sector and civil society.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Intensity of the pressure on the natural resources: soil, water and agro-biodiversity,

baseline.comment: The baseline value will be measured during the first year of implementation. Overgrazing, erosion rates, land cover, soil productivity, water management, carbon stored in agro-systems and agro-biodiversity will be some of the indicators used by the monitoring system, to monitor global environment benefits.

target.comment: The target will be determined once the monitoring system is implemented, and the baseline value defined.

actual.comment: The initiatives implemented as part of the project allowed the optimization of the use of natural resources, which was evidenced in a improved management of them, benefiting the peasant communities.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Area managed according sustainable land, water and agro-biodiversity management considerations.

baseline.comment: 0 km ² of the area of the 2 provinces

target.comment: 50% of the area of the 2 Provinces (1,900 km2) subject to plans for productive, social and infrastructural development and spatial ordination which incorporate sustainable land, water and agro-biodiversity management considerations

actual.comment: 4753,04 Km2 (corresponding to two provinces) count with updated Development Plans (community, distrital, and provincial levels), 2 Plans of Water Resources Integrated Management, 02 processes of Ecological Economic Zonification concluded; these instruments incorporate strategic guidelines of SLM. Regarding the Development Plans of districts and provinces, 40%-65% of the proposals are related to the SLM, including the management of water resources, grassland, solid waste, and agroecological productive systems.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Total funds invested in LMS, water management and biodiversity conservation, increasing resilience to climate change.

target.comment:
At the end of the Project,    
       25% of the Social Trust Fund,
       70% of the funds invested by Xstrata
       The sustainable management of soil, water and agro-biodiversity has become a requirement for the assignation of public budget to farming and infrastructure development projects.

actual.comment: Although funds from the mining activity were not allocated, other sources such as regional governments and NGOs contributed with funds to the project, in order to achieve its goals.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Outcome 1: Strengthened capacities of institutions and community representatives in Las Bambas to plan, propose and evaluate initiatives in support of SLM

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Number of persons (public servants, regional government leaders, NGO and professional) trained in SLM focused project management, and planning tools: Territory Organization Plans (TOP), Land Use Plans (LUP), Hydric Resources Management Plans (HRMP) and Droughts and Desertification Vulnerability Plans of the Province (DDVP)

baseline.comment: Baseline value will be determined during the first year of implementation

target.comment:
At the end of year 2, 40 additional persons trained in project management and planning tools, with a focus on SLM
At the end of year 5, 200 additional persons trained in project management and planning tools, with a focus on SLM

actual.comment:
- 151 authorities, 122 public servants, and 318 leaders from local, regional and national levels have participated in processes related to planning, land use, water resources integrated management, and research.
- 1142 community leaders, public servants, and authorities have participated in at least one from 124 events organized by the project.
- 6882 attenders participated in at least one of the events organized by the project, between 2011- 2014 (52% men, 48% women)
- Acquired capabilities included not only in planning instruments and participatory processes, but also in the understanding of the relations and interactions between sustainable development and territory.
- Although the directive representatives of Las Bambas Mining Company were changed during 2013- 2014, they participated in every process organized by the project, and complemented their work plans with the project planning

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Number of institutional bodies (Municipal and Regional Environmental Commissions and local government associations (including mancomunidades)

baseline.comment: Four institutional bodies (2 Municipal Environmental Commissions, 1 Regional Environmental Commission and 1 ASGOL) have integrated SLM in their priorities and action plans.

target.comment: At the end of year 5, seven institutional bodies (2 Municipal Environmental Commissions, 1 Regional Environmental Commission and 1 ASGOL and 3 mancomunidades) have integrated SLM in their priorities and action plans.

actual.comment: Organizations were formed and strengthened, so they can tackle environmental and development issues: 23 community development committees (CODECO, Spanish acronyms) at community level; 12 District Development Councils at district level; and the Development Council of Grau Province at province level. The Regional Environmental Committee (CAR, Spanish acronyms) was strengthened through the update of the Regional Environmental Management System (SIREGA, Spanish acronyms) and regulation of CAR’s operation and technical groups. The Regional Environmental Action Plan until 2021 was elaborated in a participatory way, as well as one Environmental Agenda and one Regional Environmental Policy. Actions targeted at building regional systems were undertaken to establish and articulate improved ways of systematic management of instruments, spaces and participation of actors in environmental management. Among these actors, can be mentioned the Municipal Environmental Committees (CAM, Spanish acronyms) at local, provincial and regional levels.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Numbers of territory management plans (Ecological and Economical Zoning (EEZ), TOP, LUP, HRMP and DDVP) elaborated in a participatory manner, approved and under implementation.

baseline.comment: Zero

target.comment:
Number of plans elaborated after 2 years::
2 EEZ (1 by province)
2 TOP (1 by province)
12 LUP (1 by district)
2 HRMP (1 by province)
1 DDVP (for the region)
After 5 years, all these tools are implemented.

actual.comment:
The area of the two provinces (3800 km2) is under a planning related to productive, social, and infrastructure development, as well as spatial planning. This planning includes factors of sustainable management of land, water and agrobiodiversity. The following instruments were elaborated:
- 02 Integrated Management Plans of Water Resources (GIRH, Spanish acronyms) for two sub-basins (Santo Tomas Media and Vilcabamba) were elaborated through a participatory process and strengthening of capabilities.
- 06 Community Management Plans of grasslands and pasturelands were designed through a participatory process with peasant communities
- A participatory process for the elaboration of the Ecological Economic Zonification (ZEE, Spanish acronyms) was undertaken in the two provinces; an approximation of the ZEE is under revision by the Ministry of Environment

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Numbers of projects approved and implemented in the two provinces, which promote actively the SLM and which are financed by the state and private partners.

baseline.comment: Four projects are promoting SLM in the area of intervention

target.comment:
After 5 years, SLM issue is integrated in 25 projects:
       15 of them (3/year) are financed by the Social Fund.
       5 projects (1/year) Is financed by the regional government and province municipalities,
       5 projects (1/year) financed by NGO and private companies.

actual.comment: The land use planning promoted by the project has been reflected in the formulation of 10 medium and large size projects which demand an investment of US$ 10,446,000. The projects were elaborated by public servants of the municipalities and technical personnel of different organizations at local, district and regional levels.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Outcome 2: Strengthened capacities of farmers in Las Bambas to apply SLM in productive systems.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Number of farmer families and communities trained to integrate sustainable land, water and agro-biodiversity management practices in the local productive systems and local development plans.

baseline.comment:
0 community
0 family

target.comment: At least 25% of the 75 communities and 25% of the 10,000 families

actual.comment:
- Farmers from 23 communities have been incorporating SLM practices in their lands, improving in this way the yield of their production, mitigating their vulnerability to climate change (especially to droughts), and maintaining sustainable livelihoods, in order to increase their food security and provide food to surrounding communities and private organizations in the area.
- 3225 farmers (58% men and 42% women) have been trained by the project to improve their capabilities in land management techniques. As consequence, farmers now have two agricultural campaigns, which go from July to October and from October to May- June.
- 1225 families have been assisted by the project and promoters during the project implementation.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Implementation of the M&E system at the community and watershed levels, to monitor the state of the environment, the pressure on land, water and agro-biodiversity resources, and behavior changes.

baseline.comment: There is no M&E system in place

target.comment: During the 1st years, the M&E system in implemented in 2 districts, 100% of the communities and watershed, and the baseline is established.

actual.comment:
- 12 schools of the Project area have 3-year serial data on environmental variables (water quality, soil quality, vegetation cover, atmosphere parameters), as a result of the implementation of GLOBE program. The program consisted on the training of high school students in the collection and interpretation of variables such as pH, acidity, transparency, cloud characterization, vegetal cover (grass, shrub and forest), as well as the installation of 12 meteorological stations. Actions of the program were particularly relevant in a context of mining activity in the project area, which impacts on environment should be monitored through the analysis of certain variables.
?- Strengthening of the Regional Environmental Information System (SIAR, Spanish acronyms) of the Regional Government of Apurimac. As part of this action, a Meteorological Observatory has been installed to obtain information on environmental variables at real time, starting in this way a Climatic Event Early Prevention System in the ViIcabamba sub- basin. The observatory is also integrated to the Meteorological National System.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Food security level in the direct intervention area of the project.

baseline.comment: 71 % of children (under 5 years old) are suffering from chronic malnutrition.

target.comment: At the end of year 5, the chronic malnutrition is reduced by 10%

actual.comment:
- Activities of the project related to link the increment of production and improvement in dietary supplementation have been reflected in the assistance given to the families of communities.
- One of the impacts is the increment of food quantity, through the improvement of capabilities to take advantage of abandoned land, due to the lack of access to water.
- Another impact is the improvement of food quality, due to the organic certification of crops.
- The improved capabilities of producers to ensure a stock of food throughout the year are another impact that gives them resilience towards externals events such as price increase, drought, and dependence on foreign agricultural chemicals.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Income per family in the area of intervention of the Project.

baseline.comment: US$ 60 per capita, monthly, in Cotabambas province, and US$ 66 per capita, monthly, in Grau province

target.comment: After 5 years, average annual income per family increases by 25%

actual.comment:
- Producers of the communities have increased their income per family beyond 35%, through the commercialization of agricultural and livestock surpluses (honey, avocado, tuna, guinea pig)
- Promotion of associativity to meet requirements for the commercialization of food to potential clients. Among these clients can be mentioned Xtrata Mining Company, where producers sell native potato.
- Registration of an organization of organic farmers (composed by producers from 23 communities) into the governmental program AGROIDEAS, to receive continuing assistance in their organic production after the culmination of the project, which represents interesting opportunities for accessing to local and regional markets of organic products.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Number of payment for environmental services pilot projects

baseline.comment: No PES in the area of intervention

target.comment: After 5 years, 2 PES pilot projects are implemented

actual.comment:
- The weakened representative organizations in the project prevented the facilitation of arrangements for PES. Consequently, the project worked on the strengthening of capabilities of such organizations to access to these schemes. Some of these organizations are the Water Users Organizations, which through the formulation of IWRM Plans, have the necessary mechanisms to start a future process of PES related to water. It is worth mentioning that the political context exerts influence in this process, which depends in part on the new majors and regional presidents recently elected.
- Study on agro- biodiversity in the area has allowed at identifying the communities with high value of agro- biodiversity and the possibilities of gaining equal conditions to negotiate with national programs, through the improvement of crop varieties.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Number of watersheds and hectares with improved water management.

baseline.comment: No watersheds have improved water management practices.

target.comment: 3 different watersheds covering 3,923 km ², by the end of year 5

actual.comment:
- 2 watersheds count with 2 IWRM plans that cover 3,923 km². 929 water users have participated during the elaboration process of such plans. Due to that the geographical area of the Project does not cover the total area of the basin, the participation of stakeholders coming from other areas of the basin was represented by the directive boards of formal organizations existing in those areas.
- 68 Water Users Organizations (no more than 10 formal organizations existed in the area before the Project) have been strengthened and currently recognized by the National Authority of Water (ANA, Spanish acronyms).
- This process is complemented by another local project that has recently started in the area and is promoted by the municipalities in relation to sanitation. This project includes the formulation of IWRM plans, which will complement the process started by the SLM Project.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Number of hectares dedicated to native crops

baseline.comment: 530 hectares with 5 native crops

target.comment: 7 native crops promoted or reintroduced, covering a surface of 2,650 ha (+300% increase) in the area of intervention

actual.comment: 708 hectares (including 7 types of crops) have received organic certification. 372.2 hectares have the C1 category and the remaining area, C2 category. The total area considered includes the comunal lands called laymes. The Project has worked with the community members to specialize them in the production of seeds of native potatoes, quinoa, and other products within their laymes.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Outcome 3: Developed nationwide best practice for interactions between the private sector, Government and farmers in support of SLM

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: A Code of Best Practices on Private sector, Government, NGOs and local communities interactions, including provisions for sustainable land, water and agro-biodiversity management

baseline.comment: Such a Best Practices Code does not exist

target.comment: The Code is elaborated and validated by all the stakeholders, and taken into account within the environmental regulation for mining projects.

actual.comment: The draft version of the Code is under revision by the Ministry of Environment. It is expected to be improved through a process of consultation and then to be disseminated as part of the National Strategy to Combat Desertification.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Number of regional governments and private mining companies aware of the Code.

baseline.comment:
The Code does not exist yet.
Xstrata (mining company) and the regional government of Apurimac are the only aware of its elaboration.

target.comment: All the regional governments and the mining companies are familiar with the Code.

actual.comment: The draft version of the Code is under revision by the Ministry of Environment. It is expected to be improved through a process of consultation and then to be disseminated as part of the National Strategy to Combat Desertification.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Number of mining companies implementing the Code.

baseline.comment: None, the Code does not exist yet.

target.comment:
At the end of the project, the Code is mainstreamed in the company policy of three major mining companies
Three projects of major mining companies implement the Code.

actual.comment: The draft version of the Code is under revision by the Ministry of Environment. It is expected to be improved through a process of consultation and then to be disseminated as part of the National Strategy to Combat Desertification.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Result based budget of the MINAM including SLM related activities.

baseline.comment: Zero specific result and result based budget of the MINAM on SLM related activities.

target.comment:
After two years, one (1) specific result on SLM.
After 5 years, the sustainable management of soil, water and agro-biodiversity has become a requirement for the assignation of public budget to farming and infrastructure development projects.

actual.comment:
The relationship process with the Ministry of Economy and Finance for the incorporation of the SLM guidelines in the public budget was undertaken within the frame of institutional activities promoted by the Ministry of Environment, having as consequence a set of guidelines for the recovery of ecosystem services of water supply and land degradation.
Different kinds of platforms in planification were promoted by the project at national and local levels. As a result authorities, with the support of the project, promoted and developed several plans, documents, and studies related to natural resources, to guide and create a common development vision, including natural resources management and SLM.

iati-activity.title: Gran Ecosistema Marino de la Corriente de Humboldt
iati-activity.description: Hacia la gestión del ecosistema de la Gran Corriente Marina de Humbold y acciones de adaptación.

document-link.title: Reporte de la Evaluación de Medio Termino

iati-activity.title: Ecosistema Corriente Humboldt
iati-activity.description: El objetivo del proyecto es avanzar hacia el manejo con enfoque de ecosistema para el Gran Ecosistema Marino de la Corriente de Humboldt (GEMCH) a través de un marco coordinado que fortalezca la gobernanza y el uso sostenible de los recursos marinos.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Agreement on and understanding of the ecosystem-level issues of the HCLME as they relate to management of living marine resources (LMR) and biodiversity conservation. 2. Increase in the % of fisheries management decisions that are based on integrated information on multi-specific criteria and multi-disciplinary parameters, including natural and ENSO-related variability. 3. Increased area of priority coastal, coastal-marine and marine habitats in Peru & Chile that are under some form of legal protection that contributes to biodiversity conservation. 4. Increase in the number of certifiable fisheries. 5. % increased awareness in identified target groups, of the benefits of applying EBM.

baseline.comment: Level of EMB understanding amongst project stakeholders is extremely varied. Those that depend upon the resource for their livelihoods are least aware of the concept, values, links to other sectors and the real risks. Both Chile and Peru use single stock criteria for fisheries management, responses to ENSO are not precautionary but reactive. The Peruvian Government Decree 024-2009 established a national Park covering 33 islands and capes and an area of 140,884ha Chile had 10% of its territory under Marine Park protection by 2012. A national park network organization is to be established by 2015. The necessary conditions for certifying a fishery are not yet in place. After training courses 2011 & early 2012 Chile-Peru, 70% of stakeholders with a biological or fisheries management background are aware of the EMB concept. However amongst other stakeholder groups at the Provincial level the level of awareness is <5%.

target.comment: Análisis de Diagnóstico Ecosistémico (ADE) del GEMCH desarrollado y completo PAE revisado y aprobado al más alto nivel. Programa de concientización sobre MEE finalizado Programa de fortalecimiento de capacidades institucionales para l ia implementación del PAE implementado. Se desarrollan herramientas de gestión

actual.comment: Instrumentos de planificación y política para el manejo con enfoque ecosistémico (MEE) del GEMCH acordados e implementados a nivel regional y nacional. Análisis de Diagnóstico Ecosistémico (ADE) del GEMCH desarrollado y completo Taller Fase 2 del Análisis Diagnóstico Ecosistémico Transzonal (ADET), pendiente su traducción Talleres de Evaluación de Riesgo Ecológico (ERE) para cada sitio piloto. Parcialmente terminado en el Perú Se avanzó con la formulación del Programa de Acción Estratégico (PAE) para alcanzar el MEE, que incluye un plan de Sistema de Áreas Marinas Protegidas del GEMCH. Iniciada la valorización económica de bienes y servicios del GEMCH Desarrollada y acordada la Hoja de ruta para el Programa de Acción Estratégica (PAE) Implementación del Plan Comunicacional Capacitación para los usuarios de las licencias ARcGIS (primera etapa: Conceptos básicos para usuario nivel básico; segunda etapa: usuario avanzado contratar experto de ESRI). Terminado con éxito. Adquisición de módulos Geoestadística y Análisis 3D de ArcGis. Terminado con éxito. Generar información ambiental utilizable sobre pesquerías y medio ambiente. Ictiómetro comprado para IFOP. Taller de Análisis y Evaluación cuantitativa de Comunidades Bentónicas Taller de estandarización de metodologías de evaluación para invertebrados marinos. Conferencias internacionales relacionados con MEE y 2.4.4 Cursos Internacionales para Fortalecimientos de capacidades Cursos de buceo para acreditación de 200 pescadores artesanales. Curso de identificación de tiburones Taller metodológico binacional sobre depredadores tope Taller sobre métodos de evaluación de anchoveta del Sur de Perú y Norte de Chile Opciones de gestión para la conservación de cañones submarinos disponibles para Chile y Perú. 70% de Herramientas de gestión desarrolladas e implementadas para los tres sitios representativos del Sistema de Islas, Islotes y Puntas Guaneras: 3 sitios piloto

target.comment: Sistema de Planificación, Monitoreo y Evaluación geo-referenciado desarrollado Programa de capacitación institucional desarrollado para fortalecer a las instituciones en la implementación el PAE y MEE. Mecanismos de gobernanza de mercado desarrollados para el manejo pesquero sostenible. Programa de capacitación y apropiación para grupos de actores clave (pesquerías artesanales e industriales) implementado para aumentar el cumplimiento de los marcos regulatorios que sustentan el MEE. Plan de Manejo Maestro (PMM) con estrategia de financiamiento para las Islas Islotes y Puntas Guaneras desarrollado nfoques coordinados de manejo piloteados para el stock compartido de anchoveta Estrategias y legislación para AMPs comparable para ambos países. Herramientas de manejo desarrolladas e implementadas para tres sitios representativos del Sistema de Islas, Islotes y Puntas Guaneras de la Reservas Nacional de Paracas. Programas de capacitación, concienciación y manejo de asuntos socio-ambientales implementado para las autoridades y actores involucrados en las AMP piloto.

actual.comment: Actualizado Setiembre 2015 Plan de gestión financiera para la RNSIIPG En el marco del Programa de Capacitación se desarrollo el Curso sobre opciones de certificación de pesca. En proceso el estudio de biodiversidad alternativa Fortalecimiento de capacidades a través de la participación de los Representantes de Perú y Chile en la 17th Annual Large Marine Ecosystem Meeting y la Conferencia Engaging the Seafood Industry in Social Development . Se realizó el Curso de ordenación Marino Costero por la NOAA en Pisco, Ica, Perú. Se realizó el Taller de Indicadores de Ecosistemas e Índice de Salud del océano en Lima. Se llevaron a cabo actividades de comunicación con Consermar y Amig@ s del Mar

result.title: Objective
result.description: Ecosystem-based management in the HCLME is advanced through a coordinated framework that provides for improved governance and the sustainable use of living marine resources and services

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Agreement on and understanding of the ecosystem-level issues of the HCLME as they relate to management of living marine resources (LMR) and biodiversity conservation.

baseline.comment: Concerns relative to management of HCLME LMR limited to main shared commercial fishery stocks and impacts of environmental volatility

target.comment: Countries agree on the scope and priority of ecosystem level issues & develop interventions to address them in the SAP including management of shared fisheries from an EBM perspective

actual.comment: The TDA is approved and the final draft SAP, based on agreements made with both Chile and Peru Technical Working Groups, has been sent to both countries for their final comments. These are due 5th August and the deadline for approval is mid September 2015.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Increase in the % of fisheries management decisions that are based on integrated information on multi-specific criteria and multi-disciplinary parameters, including natural and ENSO-related variability

baseline.comment:
Both Chile and Peru use single stock criteria for fisheries management, responses to ENSO are not precautionary but reactive
Note: A management decision matrix will be defined in year 1of project for monitoring this indicator

target.comment:
The shared anchovy fishery is managed using multi-specific criteria & multi -disciplinary parameters
At least 50% of the decisions in management matrix include multi-specific criteria and multi-disciplinary parameters

actual.comment: After a series of workshops both countries are getting closer to EBFM regarding both the shared anchovy fishery and others. Towards the end of 2015 there will be another annual binational workshop regarding the shared anchovy fish stock. These meetings were frozen from 2008 to 2014 and restarted after the marine boarder dispute was settled at the Hague on 27.01.2014.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Increased area of priority coastal, coastal-marine and marine habitats in Peru & Chile that are under some form of legal protection that contributes to biodiversity conservation.

baseline.comment:
Country & Habitat Area ha.
Peru:
Coastal 216,409
Marine 118,591
Chile:
Seamounts MPA* 0
Seamounts VME** 0
*Marine Protected Area
**Vulnerable Marine Ecosystem (VME)

target.comment:
Country & Habitat Area (ha.)
Peru:
Coastal 395,867
Marine 130,491
Chile:
Seamounts MPA* 8,300
Seamounts VME** 507,000
*Estimated by 1.5 m round seamount apex
**Under increased protection through VME protocol and fishing regulations; area estimated as per MPA x # of seamounts

actual.comment: The target level has been exceeded with 12,000Km2 of MPA confirmed in Chile along with studies to confirm where new MPAs should be established in years to come. In addition Management Plans have been drawn up for these new areas. In Peru Coastal Marine Spatial Planning work is going ahead and this process will draw on a range of studies carried out by this project and its partners regarding new protected areas. Furthermore all 118 seamounts are now protected including 3 in the Project's pilot site area in Chile as the Seamounts now form part of a Marine Park. Target exceeded in Chile. However additional MPAs * in Peru, although planned with Project assistance have as yet not been endorsed. * There are in fact no MPAs in Peru as the terminology used is Natural Protected Areas (NPA) and all current areas are a mix of land based areas with an extension of coastal waters associated.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Increase in the number of certifiable fisheries

baseline.comment: The necessary conditions for certifying a fishery are not yet in place

target.comment: At least one fishery has the necessary elements for certification

actual.comment: The first artisanal fishery in the SE Pacific has been MSC certified in 2014 (Juan Fernandez Rock Lobster Fishery). Other fisheries including the Peruvian Anchovy, Mahi Mahi, and Scallops are being assessed. The project's target has been met.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: % increased awareness in identified target groups, of the benefits of applying EBM

baseline.comment: % awareness of a defined number of target groups to be determined in the first 6months of the project

target.comment: 30% increase from the baseline value for each target group

actual.comment: EBM and EBFM among similar topics are now well embedded in both public and private sector mind-sets. Furthermore the IUCN 12 basic EMB principles are now well understood together with their means of implementation. The target has been met.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Planning and policy instruments for ecosystem-based management (EBM) of the HCLME are agreed and in place at regional and national levels

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: A Strategic Action Plan (SAP) developed based on up- dated ecosystem information and with an EBM approach is approved by both countries at the highest levels

baseline.comment:
There is currently no common planning process or definition of priority actions
Limited understanding of EBM

target.comment: Complete SAP is endorsed at the highest levels by both countries

actual.comment: The SAP has been finalized based on stakeholder comments. The final draft is back with the technical working groups from both countries for final remarks due 5th August 2015. The intention is to incorporate these final comments and seek approval mid September 2015. Coastal Marine Spatial Planning has been promoted by the Project with NOAA assistance in both countries. A USD70,000 NOAA Grant has been endorsed to promote the CMSP process in Peru. A Ministerial Resolution has been achieved to promote the planning process See: http://www.minam.gob.pe/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/RM-N%C2%B0-189-2015-MINAM.pdf

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: National Action Plans (NAPs) developed within the SAP framework and approved in each country

baseline.comment:
There are no national plans to prioritize actions for HCLM management.
Existing plans are sector based

target.comment: NAPs approved at the highest level in each country

actual.comment:
Although the SAP has as yet not been approved new NAPs are being approved like the ICZM strategic planning resolution mentioned above:
http://www.minam.gob.pe/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/RM-N%C2%B0-189-2015-MINAM.pdf

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description:
% of the priority actions identified in plans that have secure financing:
(a) regional level in SAP
(b)national level in the NAP

baseline.comment:
(a) 0
(b) Peru =0
Chile =0

target.comment:
(a)40%
(b) Peru =60%
Chile =60

actual.comment: A financial study has been carried out by the Project so as to suggest alternative ways of funding the Guano Islands and Capes National Reserve in Peru. This study is also of use to Chile regarding public-private methods of MPA funding.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Existence of short, medium and long-term targets for marine & coastal habitat conservation

baseline.comment: National protected area system strategies do not have specific targets for coastal marine conservation

target.comment: NPAS identify priority to reduce habitat representativity gaps and have specific targets & implementation strategies

actual.comment: Conservation objectives have been established in Peru and work to be finalized before the end of 2015 in Chile (Management Plans for MUMPAs and Vulnerable Area identification work) similar objectives will have been announced at the Our Ocean International event 5th & 6th October 2015 in Valparaiso, Chile.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Number of sectors represented and level of officials that participate in the national inter-sectoral committees

baseline.comment: To be measured in yr 1 as NIC do not yet exist

target.comment: The numbers of sectors represented and levels when NIC are first formed, are maintained and strengthened throughout the project

actual.comment: Participants within the National Intersectoral Committees continue to increase with new private sector and local NGO permanent membership. In addition work within the Communications Strategy implementation networks have brought more Civil Society Organisation groups into the cooperation framework.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Institutional capacities strengthened for SAP implementation and for up-scaling pilot interventions to the system level

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1. % of effective information exchanges in protocols defined within the framework of the Ecosystem Information System (EIS)

baseline.comment: Currently, each government manages independent Geographical Information Systems (GIS) with limited information exchange.

target.comment: 70% of protocols for information exchange are functioning at least at minimal levels

actual.comment: Many information exchange mechanisms are now in place via the Communications Strategy and communications experts within all counterpart entities (brought together by the Amig@s del Mar initiative) See project website. Target reached.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: % of staff profiles and procedures that are aligned with EBM in key institutions (i.e., CONAMA, MINAM, SUBPESCA, Vice-Minist. de PesquerÃ­a)

baseline.comment:
<10% of staff in IFOP, IMARPE have profiles aligned with needs for EBM
Staff profiles & procedures for EBM will be determined in yr 1 once standards have been set based on agreed EBM definition

target.comment:
20% of staff in IFOP, IMARPE have profiles aligned with needs for EBM
70% of the research projects for resource management follow ecosystemic criteria
Targets for other institutions to be determined in year 1

actual.comment: Targets reached. The level of awareness within both public and private entities has increased dramatically due to both project capacity building work and the initiatives of both government funding programmes.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Key institutions (MINAM CONAMA, SUBPESCA), have the capacities and internal processes to prioritize the creation of new MPAs and to manage them effectively.

baseline.comment: Baseline to be established with institutional capacity scorecard values applied to relevant institutions on each country

target.comment: 30% above baseline values

actual.comment: Management plans for new MPAs are being finalized: in the case of Chile this amounts to new MPAs (Multiple Use) in addition to the identification of vulnerable areas to be given protection status in the future. Similar work in Peru has centred on the Guano Islands and Capes National Reserve (RNSIIPG) with additional areas being prioritized for MUMPA status.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Procedures defined and adopted to promote good fisheries practices and improve market competitiveness within the framework of the HCLME

baseline.comment: There are no procedures for promoting good fisheries practices in relation to market competitiveness in either country

target.comment: At least two mechanisms are adopted that promote good practices and improve market competitiveness within the framework of the HCLME

actual.comment: The Chilean Juan Fernandez Rock Lobster fishery received MSC certification early 2015. Market competitiveness has also been promoted for macro algae added value production from a 23km extension of algal beds in southern Peru and habitat restoration work covering 50ha in Paracas Bay Peru. Management plans for the co-management of other important fisheries including scallops in northern Peru have been established.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Improved understanding of the benefits of ecosystem goods and services of artisanal fisher representatives that participate in fisheries fora (as a proxy indicator of potential compliance with regulatory frameworks)

baseline.comment: Baseline level of understanding of ecosystem benefits in will be measured in at project start

target.comment: Increase of 30% above baseline values

actual.comment: In 2015 an Economic Valuation of the Goods and Services provided by the HCLME was finalized with a USD19.5 billion value placed on their annual delivery. Value addition work in both countries and analyses carried out under the TDA-SAP process have shown that while fisheries landing volumes are decreasing year-on-year their value are increasing.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Implementation of priority MPA & fisheries management tools provides knowledge of options for enhanced protection of HCLME and SAP implementation

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Advances in adopting EBM for the shared anchovy stock as measured by the increase in agreed on and coordinated program of activities

baseline.comment: Current agreement between IFOP and IMARPE only includes information exchange on stock evaluations and reproductive parameters for main pelagic commercial stocks

target.comment: Coordinated management agreement includes the use of multi-specific criteria and multi-disciplinary parameters for the establishment of each country\\\\\\\'s TAC for the shared stock

actual.comment: IFOP Chile has recently made a joint assessment of the shared anchovy stock based on their data and that posted on the IMARPE website, thus demonstrating the importance of information sharing. Seminars and workshops on top predators and methods of shared stock evaluation continued in the reporting period. Courses on the bioeconomics of fish stock recovery have been successfully delivered in both Chile and Peru by a Chilean fisheries biologist. This target only partially achieved.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Adoption of coordinated management measures for the shared stock, such as closures, quotas and exclusion areas

baseline.comment: Each country uses independent criteria for managing their part of the shared stock

target.comment: Countries use the same criteria for establishing TACs, fishing seasons and exclusion areas

actual.comment: Work towards the use of the same evaluation criteria, or at least ways of ensuring improved correlation between the methodologies use, continues. However as yet the two countries do not use the same criteria. Target partially achieved.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Increase in hectares of the coastal-marine interface under improved management - measured by RNSIIPG Master Plan and the tools for monitoring and management effectiveness measurement

baseline.comment:
RNSIIPG has not yet been established.
See ProDoc for METT score by category.
Capes and islands of the guano systems are currently managed from an extractive perspective only targeting guano birds as conservation priorities worthy of protection.

target.comment:
RNSIIPG established with a fully developed Management Plan
See ProDoc for METT score by category.
The GEF METT has been used to establish initial baseline and target values but a more specific M&E tool for marine areas will be developed in the FSP and will also be used to measure management effectiveness gains

actual.comment: Zoning work for the RNSIIPG has been advanced this reporting period. In addition a financial management plan for the protected area has been designed. A study using drone technology has been finalized to assist SERNANP and AGRORURAL to make decisions about the opening and closing of guano extraction times so as to have a minimal impact on seabirds. The METT score will be updated at the start of 2016 as part of the Final Review process. The RNSIIPG Master Plan will be approved at the end of 2015 while acknowledging that some work will remain at a range of the 33 sites not included as pilot areas under the GEF-UNDP Humboldt project.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Identification of equivalency in conservation management options (PAs) for coastal and marine environments in both countries

baseline.comment:
Peru has no specific protected area categories for marine areas, but uses terrestrial categories, that follow a gradient from direct to indirect resource use with no fully intangible protected areas.
Chile has three categories for marine areas (Marine Reserves, Marine Parks and MUMPAS).
These management schemes and categories are not equivalent for both countries

target.comment: SNAP and SINANPE MPA conservation categories defined, equated and based on a common concept for both countries

actual.comment: Work is on-going regarding a comparison of protected area legislation between the two countries. To date Peru still does not have MPAs or MUMPAs, TURFs and other territorial based co-management areas. Nevertheless the project has been instrumental in promoting Coastal Marine Spatial Planning work assisted by trainers from NOAA. This work will continue during the remainder of the Project and after closure with a direct link to the new Coastal Fisheries Initiative in Ecuador and Peru with the possibility of drawing on Chilean experience with MPAs, MUMPAs and TURFs. The GEF-UNDP Humboldt Project is developing a management plans for a new 12,000km2 MUMPA area in Chile.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Number of best management practices developed in the project pilot sites that are up-scaled to other protected areas

target.comment: a) Peru: 3 other sites in the RNSIIPG with management committees and plans b) Chile: at least one other canyon or seamount in the process of adoption the management options

actual.comment:
Targets achieved.
a) Good management plans regarding the start and end of guano harvesting are ready for use at all 33 RNSIIPG sites in Peru. Similarly the financial management options are available for all RNSIIPG sites and possibly Chile as well. The use of drones for assessing wildlife in isolated areas has proved to be effective.
b) Marine parks have been established around two seamounts in Chile with all seamounts receiving a degree of protection under the 2013 fisheries Law.

result.title: Outcome 4
result.description: Implementation of pilot MPAs that underpin ecosystem conservation and resilience

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
1. Increase in management effectiveness of the pilot MPAs measured
a) in Peru with
a) Management Plans
b) b) with the Declaration of the area in Chile
c)Management effectiveness tracking tool (METT)
METT Poor= < 25%; Fair=2650%:, Good= 5176%:; Excellent= 77100%

baseline.comment:
(a) 3 pilot areas in Peru do not have management plans; in Chile only specific fisheries (orange roughy) are currently managed in sea mounts
(b) METT values
Peru (See ProDoc Logframe for METT score by category)
Chile
Seamount 1& 2 METT 5/63 = 8% Poor

target.comment:
(a) All 3 pilots in Peru with approved management plans; Ecosystem-based management strategy for 2 sea mounts agreed on by relevant stakeholders
(b) (b) METT values
Peru (See ProDoc Logframe for METT score by category)
Chile
Seamount 1&2 METT 30% (Fair or more)

actual.comment: Targets partially achieved. The three Pilot Sites in Peru have baseline surveys, conservation plans and zoning carried out although these have not as yet been fully approved in a 33 site Management Plan. The Management Plans for the Seamounts (as Marine Parks) within the MUMPA area (JF6 - is actually outside the MUMPA area and will have to be considered separately) will be submitted semester II 2015. As mentioned above METT results will be updated early 2016 in relation to the final review process.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 2. Reduction in the incidence of illegal extractive activities in restricted areas established in the management plans of RNSIIPG pilot sites

baseline.comment: No. of reports of illegal extractive activities will be measured once zoning of pilots is complete

target.comment: Reduction of 50% for RNSIIPG

actual.comment: Capacity building work with the management groups at each of the 33 RNSIIPG sites has successfully provided a mechanism for local level monitoring control and surveillance systems to reduce illegal activities like the use of explosives, poisons and illegal fishing gear in the areas surrounding and within the National Reserve. Although not as yet quantified via the monitoring reports a reduction of illegal activities is evident.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description:
3. % management costs of the pilot areas protected that have secure financing
(a) a) RNSIIPG pilots
(b) b) Seamounts

baseline.comment: As neither the RNSIIPG nor the Seamount MPA has been established there are currently no specific management costs.

target.comment:
a) 100% of the RNSIIPG pilots management costs covered of which at least 50% is from resources other than GoP
b) Seamount have identified sources for 100% management costs

actual.comment:
a) A financial management plan has been produced for the RNSIIPG as an update to the version created in 2009 prior to the RNSIIPG establishment. At present 50% of the RNSIIPG costs are covered by tourist activities associated with the 300,000 visitors per annum to the Ballestas Islands. A number which clearly puts a high level of pressure on the wildlife and increases the risk of marine accidents caused by the high speed transport of tourists to and from the Islands.
b) JF5 management costs will be included in the MUMPA management plan under development throughout 2015. However JF6 and Bajo O'Higgins, while protected under new legislation and the fact that commercial fishing boats national and foreign are obliged to carry GPS devices when operating under license in the Chilean EEZ, do not have management costs other than the work carried out by Fisheries Patrol vessels.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: 4. Ecosystem-based management strategy for sea canyons agreed on by the relevant stakeholders

baseline.comment: No specific plans for sea canyons exist

target.comment: Approved management strategy for sea canyons of the HCLME

actual.comment: While assessment work exists in both countries this is just at a very superficial level. There will be no approved sea canyon management strategy approved by the end of this phase of the project.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description:
5. Populations of flagship species at pilots
Species will be selected in yr 1

baseline.comment: Population levels (distribution and abundance) as estimated in yr 1 for selected flagship and/or indicator species in pilots

target.comment: Populations maintain at least the same levels as at the beginning of the project or are increasing

actual.comment: Data for all species is available in both countries but not shared wither within country entities or between the two countries. Data collection also comes from a range of sources both public and NGO: TNC, WWF Birdlife international). Further work needs to be carried out to coordinate datasets with ENSO occurrences. The use of drones will greatly assist this process.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: A nivel de impacto: Número de víctimas simbólicamente reparadas. A nivel de proceso: Nivel de avance de la implementación del Lugar de la Memoria.

baseline.comment:
A diciembre del 2011, el número de víctimas individuales inscritas en Registro Único de Víctimas (RUV) es de 137,310. El número de beneficiarios colectivos inscritos en ese mismo registro es de 5,697 (fuente, Defensoría del Pueblo/CVR).
No hay un centro de memoria que repare simbólica y colectivamente a todas las víctimas (Informe Anual del Consejo de Reparaciones Octubre 2010 – octubre 2011)

target.comment: Infraestructura 100% terminada. 100% Equipamiento identificado. Diseño contenido museográfico aprobado. Un Plan de actividades de proyección pública. Una estrategia comunicacional aprobada.

actual.comment: Infraestructura al 96% (casco). Equipamiento en identificación. Guión museográfico culminado y aprobado por la CAN. Plan de actividades en implementación (inauguración de auditorio). Estrategia comunicacional en diseño.

target.comment: Construcción y equipamiento 100% terminados. Contenido museográfico implementado. Propuesta pedagógica coordinada con MINEDU. Centro de investigación implementado. Transferencia al MINCUL concluida. LUM inaugurado y funcionando.

actual.comment:
Julio 2915 Se cuenta con construcción de casco y acabados, y significativo avance enel equipamiento así como avance en el plan de contenidos del LUM. LUM con guion museográfico participativo y aprobado por la CAN en etapa de implementación. Se cuenta con diseño de centro de documentación, y plan de implementación.
Proyección Dic 2015 Place of Memory is completely equipped and its opening is done under Ministry of Culture supervision. The museum contents, approved by High Level Commission, has been totally implemented (including stories, testimonies, victims names). Place of Memory is posicionated in public opinion as an important instrument of public policy to consolidate peace culture with gender and multicultural approach. Basic lines for educational plan in tolerance, inclusion and memory is elaborated.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: - % de los aparatos que cumplan con las normas - % de ahorro de TJ (y correspondiente reducción de GEI) - Un sistema de aplicación de normas para etiquetado y MEPS - Un análisis tecno-económico conducido para priorizar tecnologías y medidas a tomar - Numero de campanas implementados para el consumidor - Número de nuevas provisiones políticas y adopción de programas para la supervisión de cumplimiento, aplicación y alcance - Número de funcionarios entrenados - Un sitio web dedicado al proyecto - Una estrategia de transformación de mercado - Una base de datos actualizada y fortalecida en el MINEM - Numero de decretos firmados por el concejo de ministros sobre regulaciones técnicas para la elaboración de etiquetas - Numero de decretos del gobierno del Presidente, refrendando S&L como obligatorio - Numero de incentivos específicos entregados

baseline.comment: - No existen suficientes capacidades en agencias públicas y privadas para diseñar, implementar y hacer cumplir un programa obligatorio de Normas & Etiquetado en productos electronicos - No hay una estrategia de transformación de mercado que favoresca los productos eficientes - Marco legal de Normas y Eco - etiquetado es insufciciente - Falta de la conciencia del consumidor

target.comment: Resultado 1. Nuevas provisiones políticas y adopción de programas para la supervisión de cumplimiento, aplicación y alcance, que reflejen las "mejores prácticas" internacionales. 100 funcionarios capacitados (todo el proyecto). Sitio web en funcionamiento Resultado 2. Base de datos actualizada regularmente, en ventas anuales y consumo de energía y las características tecnológicas de los diferentes aparatos de acuerdo a clases de energía dispoinbles para uso público (con metodología de mercadeo de mercado finalizada). Elaborar estrategia de transformación de mercado. Resultado 3. Decretos firmados por el Consejo de Minisitros sobre regulaciones técnicas para elaboración de etiquetas (y/o MEPS) obligatorias para refrigeradoras, congeladoras, calentadores de agua, lavadoras y motores elétricos. Resultado 4. Campañas conjuntas de mercadeo con los fabricantes y cadena de ventas al detal resaltando los aspectos de EEs.

actual.comment: Resultado 1. Se cuenta con Base de datos de Eficiencia Energética y el Etiquetado, en el cual se puede encontrar datos sobre evolución del impacto de EE, consumo de energía y otros al 2013 elaborada. 25 funcionarios capacitados Sitio web funcionado y en proceso de difusión. Resultado 2. Estrategia de Transformación de Mercado elaborada. Resultado 3. Se cuenta con una propuesta de Lineamientos estratégicos de introducción de reglamentos técnicos, publicada oficialmente mediante Decreto el Lineamiento General del Etiquetado. Resultado 4. Se realizó la "I Conferencia Descentralizada sobre Etiquetado” contando con la participación de 100 personas vinculadas a la eficiencia energética en ICA -2013 y en el Simposio Nacional e Metrología de INDECOPI. Se difundieron los objetivos y las actividades del Proyecto en el stand del MINEM en el side event de Voces por el Clima organizado en el marco de la COP20.

target.comment: Resultado 1. Base de datos actualizada regularmente, en ventas anuales y consumo de energía y las características tecnológicas de los diferentes aparatos de acuerdo a clases de energía dispoinbles para uso público (con metodología de mercadeo de mercado finalizada). Institutos acreditados. Al menos 5 laboratorios acreditados. Al menos 150 funcionarios entrenados Resultado 2. Estrategia de trnasformación de mercado implementada Resultado 3. Resoluciones sobre Normas&Etiquetado aprobadas por Decreto Supremo. Reuniones nacionales, talleres y giras de estudios para tomadores de decisiones. Resultado 4. Campañas conjuntas de mercadeo con fabricantes y cadena de ventas al detail Talleres y reuniones con la industria, sociedad civil, consumidores, cadenas de venta al detail.

actual.comment: Actualizado Junio 2015 Resultado 1. Base de datos actualizada regularmente, en ventas anuales y consumo de energía y las características tecnológicas de los diferentes aparatos de acuerdo a clases de energía dispoinbles para uso público (con metodología de mercadeo de mercado finalizada). Resultado 3. Resoluciones sobre Normas&Etiquetado finalizada, actualmente en etapa de consulta pública, para su aprobación por Decreto Supremo. 04 reuniones técnicas desarrolladas con representantes de empresas productoras y de la Sociedad Nacional de Industrias y 06 reuniones con Comités Técnicos de equipos y electrodomésticos. Resultado 4. I Foro Internacional de Eficiencia Energética desarrollado. 04 Foros regionales realizados (campañas con actores y consumidores). Reuniones con 07 Colegios Públicos informados Comités de normalización de equipos y electrodomésticos 04 reuniones con empresas productoras. 2164 visitas contabilizadas a la página web del proyecto. Actualizado Octubre 2015 R1. Se cuenta con Base de Datos actualizada y completada al 100% Puesta en marcha de la consultoría de Diagnostico de Laboratorios, que permitirá conocer la situación y requisitos para la acreditación de laboratorios. R2. Puesta en marcha del Estudio de Gestión, Manejo y Disposición de Residuos Sólidos y Gaseosos de equipos energéticos. Fortalecimiento de capacidades sobre la estrategia de transformación de mercado Caso Colombiano , en especialistas de INACAL, PRODUCE y MEF. R3. Concluida la etapa de consulta pública de los Reglamentos Técnicos de EEFF, a fin de que se redacten los Reglamentos Finales. Se han fortalecido capacidades en representantes de empresas y el subcomité de refrigeración, definiendo aspectos relacionados a la normatividad. R4. Se han realizado la difusión sobre el Etiquetado de Eficiencia Energética con particpación de la sociedad civil, (docentes, y personal del MINEM). 2392 visitas contabilizadas a la página web del proyecto.

result.title: Objective
result.description: To reduce CO2 emissions through the implementation of a (mandatory) energy efficiency standards and labels program

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: A) Change in annual sales towards average higher efficiency appliances (lower unit energy consumption, UEC)

baseline.comment: A) See UEC table in footnote below

target.comment: A) Reduction in average UEC (see table in footnote below) of selected household appliances: (refrigerators, refrigerator-freezers and freezers; water heaters; air conditioning equipment and washing machines) and electric motors.

actual.comment: The indicator cannot be measured yet at this point of the project implementation

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: B) Share of non-compliant products

baseline.comment: B) N/A (there is no mandatory S&L)

target.comment: B) Based on the surveys of output 2.1, the role of ´informal ´ trade will be quantified. Based on this a ´non-compliant ´ product will be defined. A preliminary aim is at least 50% should be compliant by the end of the project.

actual.comment: The indicator cannot be measured yet at this point of the project implementation

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: C) GHG emission trends

baseline.comment: C) Annual electricity demand will grow to 1000 TJ by 2018 and corresponding GHG emissions (see Figure 1 in UNDP Prodoc)

target.comment: C) The Referential Plan mentions a savings potential of 54 TJ annually by the year 2018 with corresponding cumulative GHG reduction of 35.6 million tCO2 over the period 2009-2018, of which around 5% (1,780 ktCO2) due to electricity savings by consumers (excluding lighting), motors and efficient water heaters. The estimate of direct and indirect emissions (1,217 ktCO2 over the period 2011-2018) fits within the Referential Plan ´s projections. See also Section 1 in the UNDP ProDoc for more details.

actual.comment: The indicator cannot be measured yet at this point of the project implementation

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: D) Amount of CO2 emissions avoided directly and indirectly

actual.comment: The indicator cannot be measured yet at this point of the project implementation

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Enhanced capacities of key public and private agencies to design, implement and enforce a mandatory S&L programme

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: E) Status of programs in key public agencies to implement effective mandatory S&L

baseline.comment: E) Insufficient implementation of S&L program which is in guidelines only

target.comment: E) New policy provisions and compliance checking, enforcement and outreach programs adopted that reflect international â€œbest practicesâ€

actual.comment: The Directive Committee of the project has held meetings in which it has received substantial information provided by the different consultancies/ studies undertaken during the project implementation. This learning process has enabled their capabilities for designing, implementing and enforcing a mandatory S&L program. The committee is formed by key entities in the matter, such as the Ministry of Environment, Ministry of Energy and Mines, Ministry of Production, Ministry of Economy and Finance, Ministry of External Commerce and Tourism, INDECOPI (National Institute for the defense of the competence and protection of intellectual property), SUNAT (National Superintendence of Customs and Tax Administration).

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Market transformation strategy implemented with public and private sector involvement, based on consolidated information on the market structure

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: F) Level of info available to define energy consumption in label categories and for measuring project impact

baseline.comment: F) Data available in MINEMâ€™s database, but needs to be updated and expanded

target.comment: F) Regularly updated data on annual sale and energy consumption and technology characteristics of different appliances per energy classes available

actual.comment: A study was concluded in December, 2014, with the following topics: a) structure, evolution and projection of the market related to energy equipment (refrigerator, washing machine, dryer, conditioner air machine, water heater, electric motors and boiler); b) data base of energy consumption and end use of technologies; and c) measurement of environmental, energy and economic impacts for efficiency energy labeling

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: G) Status of recommendations contributing to institutional sustainability (transformation strategy)

baseline.comment: G) Data available in MINEMâ€™s database, but needs to be updated and expanded

target.comment: G) Regularly updated data on annual sale and energy consumption and technology characteristics of different appliances per energy classes available for public use (with finalized market monitoring methodology)

actual.comment:
The elaboration of the strategy depends on others processes, some of them are concluded and others are in process; therefore, the strategy has not been designed yet and is scheduled for next year. The status of such processes is:
- A study related to market aspects and energy consumption, which was detailed in a point before, was concluded in December, 2014.
- Two international bids have been launched: 1) Diagnosis and Evaluation of Laboratories for Labeling; and 2) Development of a System of Conformity Assessment for the Certification of Energy Efficiency Labeling. Currently, the proposals are under evaluation.
- A study on the management, treatment and disposal of solid waste and emissions from energy equipment; the study has been launched as part of a bidding process.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Strengthened legal framework for mandatory S&L and endorsed final Technical Regulations

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: H) Status of decision-making regarding introduction of mandatory EE S&L

baseline.comment: H) Mandatory MEPS exist for CFLs; voluntary labels and MEPS for ballasts, cloth washers, fluorescent lamps, refrigerators and freezers, air conditioners and electric water heaters

target.comment: H) Decree(s) signed by the Council of Ministers on Technical regulations making labels (and/or MEPs) mandatory in the refrigerators, freezers, water heaters , washing machines and electric motors

actual.comment: 9 projects of technical regulations related to energy efficiency were concluded at the end of December, 2014. The projects were related to the following equipment: fluorescent lamps, ballasts for fluorescent lamps used in lighting for domestic purpose, refrigerators, washing machines, dryers, conditioner air machines, water heaters, electric motors and boilers. The regulation projects were published to allow the public participation during their approval process. Up to date, more than 600 public opinions have been received and evaluated. In this context, meetings with the technical body and the decision makers to reach a consensus for the approval of such regulations are ongoing.

result.title: Outcome 4
result.description: Heightened consumer awareness and acceptance of S&L programme.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: I) Priority of different criteria used by customers in their purchasing decision and of private sector in marketing their products

baseline.comment: I) No emphasis among the consumers (and sales personnel) on energy efficiency aspects and life cycle costs when purchasing and marketing new appliances

target.comment: I) Beside the initial purchasing price, energy efficiency and life-cycle costs have become a key criteria for purchasing decisions, guided by the energy label

actual.comment: A communication strategy has been designed and a bidding process for its implementation has been launched. The strategy is targeted at consumers, to increase their awareness and acceptance to the S&L program.

result.title: Outcome 5
result.description: Information and knowledge on S&L programme generated and shared

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: J) The level of information available for monitoring and evaluation and adaptive management

baseline.comment: J) N/A

target.comment: J) Adequate information available for adaptive management and measuring the impact.

actual.comment:
A financial audit was carried out for the period 2012-2014. The auditor recommended keeping the control and follow up as part of the project management.
The quarterly reports of the physical progress of the project were handed over timely.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: N° de entidades del Gobierno Central y Regional que han mejorado y fortalecido sus capacidades para la prevención, manejo y resolución de los conflictos. N° de entidades del Gobierno Central y Regional que tienen una participación activa en la plataforma de coordinación Multisectorial y Multinivel para la PyGC.

baseline.comment: Autoridades del Gobierno see encuentran diseñando estrategias de coordinación para la gestión de conflictos a nivel central y regional.

target.comment:
5 Entidades del Gobierno Central y 8 entidades del Gobierno Regional han mejorado y fortalecido sus capacidades para la prevención, manejo y resolución de los conflictos.
5 Entidades del Gobierno Central y 8 entidades del Gobierno Regional tienen una participación activa en la plataforma de coordinación Multisectorial y Multinivel para la prevención, manejo y resolución de los conflictos.

actual.comment:
En el 2014, 8 entidades del Gobierno Central y Regional: ONDS, Defensoría del pueblo, Viceministerio de Interculturalidad, Ministerio del Ambiente, Ministerio de Energía y Minas, Autoridad Nacional del Agua, Organismo de Evaluación y Fiscalización Ambiental y al Ministerio de Agricultura, han recibido un total de 31 asistencias técnicas- AT (29 AT en el 2012 y 56 AT en el 2013). Con las asistencias técnicas brindadas se ha logrado desarrollar 24 herramientas para la Prevención y Gestión de los conflictos que a la fecha todos ellos vienen siendo implementados en las instituciones donde fueron desarrolladas. Como producto del trabajo desarrollado en el año, el 100% de las entidades entrevistadas (4 de 8) valoran positivamente el trabajo desarrollado en el desarrollo de los productos que se lograron concretar al 2014. 15 Gobiernos Regionales (Ancash, Apurímac, Arequipa, Cajamarca, Cusco, Junín, La libertad, Loreto, Madre de Dios, Moquegua, Pasco, Piura, Puno, San Martin y Tacna) y 7 entidades del estado (Ministerio de energía y Minas, Ministerio del Ambiente, Ministerio de Cultura, Ministerio de Agricultura, Autoridad Nacional del Agua, Organismo de Evaluación y Fiscalización Ambiental y la Defensoría del Pueblo) logrando concretar 10 Planes de Acción.
El proyecto ha logrado promover la creación de la “Plataforma de Coordinación ANGR – ONDS – PNUD en apoyo a fortalecer las capacidades en diálogo, prevención y gestión de conflictos de los gobiernos regionales”. La plataforma integra 15 GORES y 8 Sectores, y ha logrado generar 10 Planes de Acción con los Gobiernos Regionales.

target.comment:
6 Entidades del Gobierno Central y 8 entidades del Gobierno Regional han mejorado y fortalecido sus capacidades para la prevención, manejo y resolución de los conflictos.
6 Entidades del Gobierno Central y 8 entidades del Gobierno Regional tienen una participación activa en la plataforma de coordinación Multisectorial y Multinivel para la prevención, manejo y resolución de los conflictos.

actual.comment:
6 Sectores (PCM, Defensoría del pueblo, Viceministerio de Interculturalidad, Ministerio de Energía y Minas, Autoridad Nacional del Agua y Ministerio de la Mujer y Poblaciones Vulnerables) han mejorado y fortalecido sus capacidades para la prevención, manejo y resolución de los conflictos.
Se conformo un Grupo de Trabajo sobre Políticas Indígenas (GTPI) reconocido por el Estado con Resolución Ministerial N°403–2014–MC
Esta experiencia se está replicando a nivel regional creándose el GTPI región Ucayali con Resolución Ejecutiva Regional 0714-2015-GRU-GR esto experiencia también se viene gestando en la Región Puno.
Se realiza el “Diplomado en Prevención de Conflictos Sociales en el uso de Recursos Naturales –Modalidad virtual” Entre el 2014 y 2015 se elaboró y publicó la “Sistematización de experiencias de institucionalización del diálogo, prevención y gestión de conflictos de cuatro gobiernos regionales”, “Guía para la conformación de oficinas de diálogo en gobiernos regionales” y “Caja de herramientas sectoriales para la institucionalización del diálogo y la prevención y gestión de conflictos sociales vinculados con el uso de recursos naturales”.
Se fortaleció y reestructuró el portal web www.angr.org.pe para fortalecer el rol de la ANGR como el ente de coordinación e información para y entre los gobiernos regionales

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: - Propuesta metodológica formulada - 02 Informes aprobados de auditoría de desempeño - Personal capacitado y entrenado, al menos 30 personas, para aplicar la nueva metodología con nivel de suficiencia, así como para ejecutar Auditorías de desempeño que hayan aprobado - Importe de presupuesto ejecutado al final del proyecto - Ahorros obtenidos producto de las 02 Auditorías de Desempeño iguales o mayores al monto del costo del proyecto

baseline.comment: Los procedimientos de control gubernamental ejercidos por la Contraloría General de la República (CGR) no cuentan con una metodología actualizada concordante con las nuevas necesidades del sector público y con el nuevo enfoque de control, para el ejercicio de la auditoria de desempeño.

target.comment: Metodología de auditoría de desempeño validada y aprobada por la CGR para el desarrollo de la Auditoría de Desempeño.

actual.comment: - Elaboración del Manual de Auditoría de Desempeño, queda pendiente la pre-publicación y posterior aprobación de la misma. - Ejecución de 03 Auditoría de Desempeño Programadas, las cuales se encuentran en la etapa de Elaboración de Informe. - 01 Auditoría de Desempeño no Programada la cual ya cuenta con Informe Final aprobado y remitido a la entidad mediante Oficio N°02427-2014-CG/DC.

target.comment: Metodología validada y aprobada por la CGR para el desarrollo de la Auditoría de Desempeño como parte del nuevo enfoque de control.

actual.comment: - Four performance audits were implemented and results were published. - Improvements deals were signed between Contraloría and related institutions and are under implementation. - Communication strategy with new control approach is ongoing.
